titleStmt.title: John Leonard v. State of Washington

bibl.title: John Leonard v. State of Washington. Writ of Habeus Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States. Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington, Eastern Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of John Leonard, for A Writ of Habeus Corpus.
To the Hon. C.H. Handford, Judge of the Circuit Court of the United States, Ninth judicial circuit, District of Washington Eastern Northern Division

The petition of John Leonard respectfully shows to your Honor; First-That the said petitioner is now a prisoner imprisoned and confined in the County Jail at Colfax, Whitman County, State of Washington, in the custody of the Sheriff of Whitman County, State of Washington.

Sedond- That the cause or pretense of the restraint of the said petitioner according to the best of his knowledge and belief is, that on the 29th day of July, 1896, H.W Canfield as Prosecuting Attorney in and for the County of Whitman, State of Washington, made and filed with the Clerk of the Superior Court in and for Whitman County, an information charging the above named petitioner with the crime of Murder in the first degree, which said information is in writing in words and figures as follows, to-wit; State of Washington County of Whitman.

IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR THE COUNTY OF WHITMAN. The State of Washington, Plaintiff, INFORMATION. vs John Leonard, Defendant. Comes now H.W. Canfield, prosecuting and County Attorney, for the County of Whitman, State of Washington, and by this information accuses John Leonard, of the crime of murder in the first degree, committed as follows, to-wit: That the said John Leonard, in the County of Whitman, in the State of Washington, on the 18th day of July, eighteen hundred and
ninety -six, purposefully, and of his deliberate and premeditated malice killed Jacob Malquist by then and there purposelyand of his deliberate and premediated malice, striking, beating and mortally wounding the said Jacob Malquist upon the head of him the said Jacob Malquist, with a piece of wood of the length of thirty inches, and of the width of three inches, and of the thickness of three inches, which said piece of wood he the said John Leanord, in his hands then and there had and held, contrary to the form of the statute in such cases made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the state of Washington. Dated at Colfax this 29th day of July, A.D. 1896. H.W. Canfield, Prosecuting and County Attorney, in and for said County and State

State of Washington, County of Whitman, H.W. Canfield, being first duly sworn on oath says, he is the duly elected, acting and qualified Prosecuting and County Attorney, in and for said County and State, that he has read the foregoing information, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true. H.W. Canfield SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO BEFORE ME THIS "29TH DAY OF JULY, 1896. C. A. R O S S Clerk of said Whitman County, Washington.

WITNESSES: Ed Lewis, W.H. Steuart, C.O. Anderyson, Mrs. P. M. Silcott, Mrs. W.H. Steuart, Thos. Boling, Frank Perry, A.P. Brown, Roger Morrisy, James Barry, W.S. Elliott, Fred Bonney, Thos. Mosgrove J.D. Whiteis, C.M. Boswell, R.J. Skaife, John K. Eacho, T.W.Osborne, D.H. Shaw, O Hansen.

Third- That thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in said cause in the Superior Court of Whitman County, State of Washington, that the jury which was impanelled and sworn to try the said petitioner upon the said charge in the said information, did on the 21st day of Aug. 1896, render and return into the said Superior Court their verdict in said cause, which is in writing in words and figures as follows, to-wit;

IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OFWHITMAN. The State of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. John Leonard, Defendant. We the jury in the case of the State of Washington, plaintiff, against John Leonard, defendant, find the defendant guilty of the crime of murder in the First Degree as charged in the information. Paul Bockmier, Foreman.

Fourth- That thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in said cause, in the said Superior Court of Whitman County, that on the 24th day of Aug. 1896, the Hon. E.H. Sullivan as Judge of the Superior Court in and for Whitman County, Washington, rendered and made his judgment and sentence in said cause, which is in writing in words and figures as follows, to-wit; IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR WHITMAN COUNTY. AUGUST 24TH, 1896. The State of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. John Leonard, Defendant.

Now on this day comes the plaintiff by H.W. Canfield Prosecuting Attorney and comes also the defendant into open Court in his own proper person as well as by his attorneys John Pattison Esq., and U.L. Ettinger, Esq., when this cause came on duly and regularly for hearing upon defendants motion to set aside the verdict of the jury heretofore rendered in this cause, and duly filed herein, and to grant defendant a new trial herein said motion being duly argues to the Court by the said attorney's of the said parties respectively, and the Court having heard all the argument s of the respective counsel there on, and the Court being fully advised in the premises, overrules said notion, to all of which the defendant excepts, and exceptions allowed.

And now on this day comes the defendant in his own proper person, to receive the judgment and sentence of the Court, upon the verdict of the jury heretofore entered and filed herein. And appeared also his Counsel John Pattinson and U.L. Ettinger, Esq's. Comes also H.W. Canfiled Prosecuting Attorney and attorney for the plaintiff herein, and thereupon the said defendant was duly informed by the said Court of the said verdict of the jury, heretofore rendered and filed herein, and the defendant was thereupon asked by the Court if he had anything to say or any legal cause to show why judgment and sentence of the Court should not now be pronounced against him, and he answered that he had not, excepting as he had heretofore said. Whereupon all and singular the premises, being by the Court fully understood, it is here now considered and adjudged by the Court, that you the said defendant John Leonard, are guilty of the crime of Murder in the First degree as charged in the information herein against you and as by said verdict found.

And it is further considered and adjudged by the Court, that you the said defendant John Leonard, be taken hence to the County Jail of Whitman County, Washington, from whence you came and that you be there by the Sheriff of Whitman County, Washington, safely kept and confined, and that on the day hereafter to be appointed, set and determined you be by the sheriff of the said Whitman County, Washington taken from thence to the place of execution, and that you the said defendant John Leonard be there hanged by the neck until you be dead. E.H. Sullivan Superior Judge.

Fifth- That thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in said cause, that the Supreme Court of the State of Washington, on the
18th day of May, 1897, made and rendered its decision in the said cause, which decision is in writing in words and figures as follows to-wit, IN THE SUPREME COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON May session A.D. 1897. BE IT REMEMBERED, That at a regular sessin of the Supreme Court of the State of Washington, begun and holden at Olympia, on the 2nd Monday in May A.D. 1897, it being the tenth day of said Month, among other the following was had and done, to -wit; Tuesday May 18th, 1897 State of Washington, Respondent vs. John Leonard, Appellant. NO. 2491 J U D G E M E N T.

This cause having been heretofore submitted to the Court on the Motin of the Respondant to dismiss the appeal from the judgment of the Superior Court of Whitman County, and the Court having fully considered the same and fully advised in the premises and having filed its opinion in writing, it is now on the 18th day of May, A.D. 1897, on Motion of Thomas M. Vance Esquire, of Counsel for respondent considered, adjudged and decreed that the appeal herein be, and the same is hereby dismissed with costs, and the cause remained to the said Superior Court with directions to carry its judgment into effect, and that the said State of Washington have and recover of and from the said John Leonard the costs of this action taxed and allowed at Nineteen and 60/100 dollars, and that execution issue therefor. And it is further ordered that this cause be remitted to the said Superior Court for further proceedigns according with the opinion herein filled.

I. C. S. Reinhart, Clerk of the Supreme Court of the State of Washington, do hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the judgment and Decree in said cause, as the same now remains of record in my office. In testimony whereof, I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the seal of said Court at Olympia this 16th day of May, A.D. 1897. C.S. Reinhart, Clerk of the Supreme Court, State of Washington

Sixth- That thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in the said cause, that on the 24th day of May, 1897, William McDonald as Judge of the Superior Court of Whitman County, Washington, made an order fixing a day when the judgment and sentence of death rendered and entered into said cause, should be carried into execution, which said order is in writing in words and figures as follows, to-wit; IN THE SUPERIOR COURT IN THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR WHITMAN COUNTY, The State of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. ORDER John Leonard, Defendant.

Now on this day the above entitled matter coming on to be heard
in open Court, for the fixing of a day when the judgment and sentence of Death heretoforerendered and entered herein, shall be carried into execution, the said defendant appearing in his own proper person and by John Pattidon and U. L. Ettinger his Attorneys, the plaintiff appearing by John W. Mathews Prosecuting Attorney and County Attorney for Whitman County, Washington, and H. W. Canfield of Counsel.

And the Court being fully advised in the premises, Friday, the 2nd day of July, A.D. 1897, is hereby set and appointed by the Court as the day in which the judgment herein shall be executed. Done in open Court this 24th day of May, 1897. W I L L I A M MC DONALD. Superior Judge.

Seven- That thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in said cause in said Superior Court , that on the 24th day of May, 1897, a Death Warrant was issued under the hand and seal of the said Judge of the said Superior Court, which said Death Warrant is in writing in words and figures as follows, to-wit,

IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR WHITMAN COUNTY. The State of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. DEATH WARRANT John Leonard, Defendant. THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. To the Sheriff of Whitman Countt, Washington.

GREETING: WHEREAS THE ABOVE NAMED DEFENDANT, JOHN LEONARD, was by information of the prosecuting and County Attorney of Whitman County, Washington, filled in this Court on this 29th day of July, A.D. 1896, charged with the crime of murder in the first degree.

The above entitled cause came on regularly for trial in the above entitled Court on the 17th day of August, A.D., 1896, and a jury in said Court was duly and regularly empanneled and sworn to try the issues of said cause; and said cause then proceeded to the taking of testimony on behalf of the plaintiff and of the defendant and the argument of Counsel to said jury and said jury was instructed by the Court and retired to consider of their verdict in said cause;

And afterwards, and on, to-wit, the 21st day of August, 1896, the said defendant was convicted of the crime of murder in the first degree by the verdict of said jury, which said verdict was in the of the said defendant and his Counsel returned into Court, and which said verdict was and is as follows, to-wit; IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF WHITMAN. The State of Washington, Plaintiff vs. V E R D I C T John Leonard, Defendant.

We, the jury in the case of the State of Washington, plaintiff, against John Leonard, defendant, find thedefendant guilty of the crime of Murder in the First Degree as charged in the information. Paul Bockmier, Foreman.

And afterwards, on said verdict, the said defendant, John Leonard, was convicted of the crime of murder in the First Degree, and sentenced to suffer DEATH by the judgment and Sentence of the above entitled
Court, duly made and entered in this section on the 24th day of August, A.D. 1896, which said judgment and sentence is in words and figures as follows, to-wit; IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR WHITMAN COUNTY. The State of Washington, Plaintiff vs. JUDGMENT AND SENTENCE> John Leonard, Defendant.

And now on this day domes the above named defendant John Leonard, in his own proper person, to recieve the judgment and sentence of the Court, upon the verdict of the jury heretofore rendered, entered and filed herein and appears also his Counsel, John Pattinson and U.L. Ettinger, and comes also H. W. Canfield Prosecuting Attorney and Attorney for the plaintiff herein, and thereupon the said defendant was rendered, entered and filed herein, and the defendant was thereupon asked by the Court if he had anything to say or legal cause to show why judgment an sentence of the Court should not now be pronounced against him, and he answered that he had not expecting as he had heretofore said.

WHEREUPON , all and singular the premises being by the Court fully understood, it is here now considered and adjudged by the Court that you, the said defendant John Leonard, are guilty of the crime of Murder in the First Degree as charged in the Information herein against you, and as by said verdict found.

And it is further considered and adjudged by the Court, that you th e said defendant John Leonard, be taken from hence to the County Jail of Whitman County, Washington, from whence you came, and that you be there by the Sheriff of Whitman County, Washington, safely kept and confined, and that on the day hereafter to be appointed, set and determined, you be, by the said Sheriff of Whitman County, Wash ingotn, taken from thence to the place of execution, and that you the said defendant John Leonard, be there hanged by the neck until you be dead."

And, afterwards, on the 25th day of September, 1896, she said defendant John Leonard, filed in the above entitled Court and served upon the Prosecuting Attorney for Whitman County, Washington, his notice of appeal to the Supreme Court of the State of Washington, from the judgment and sentence herein before mentioned.

And, afterwards, and on, to-wit, the 18th day of May A.D. 1897, by the said judgment of the Supreme Court of the State of Washington judgment and sentence heretofore entered herein, was at said time by said Supreme Court dismissed and the above entitled cause was reminded to the said Superior Court with directions to carry its judgment heretofore recited into effect, and the remitti- and executed under the seal of said Court, attached by the Clerk of said Courts and filed in the office of the Clerk of the Superior Court, of the State of Washington, in and for Whitman County.
NOW THEREFORE, Friday the 2nd day of July, A.D. 1897, is hereby fixed set and appointed as the day in which the aforesaid Judgment an sentence shall be carried into execution.

IN THE NAME OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, YOU, the said Sheriff of Whitman County, Washington, are hereby commanded to take the said defendant John Leonard, to the County Jail of Whitman County, State of Washington, and him there safely keep and confine him from now until Friday, the 2nd day of July, A.D. 1897, and that on said Friday the second day of July, A.D. 1897, that you take the said defendant John Leonard, from the said County Jail of Whitman County, Washington, to
the place of execution and there hang him the said defendant, John Leonard, by the neck until he be dead and due return of your doings and proceedings hereon tomake, according to law; and herein fail not at your peril. Done in open Court this 24th day of May, A.D. 1897. WILLIAM MCDONALD Superior Judge.

In Attestation and Testimony whereof witness my hand and the seal of the said Superior Court of the State of SEAL. EWashington, in and for Whitman County this 24th day of May, 1897. C.A. Ross, County Clerk and ex-officic Clerk of the Superior Court of the State of Washington, in and for Whitman County.

Eight - That on account of the poverty of the said petitioner, the attorneys for the said petitioner who depenfed him upon the said charge contained in the said information in the Superior Court of Whitman County, Washington, did not perfect an appeal from the said Judgment and Sentence to the Supreme Court of the State of Washington and on account of the failure to perfect said appeal, the said Supreme Court of the State of Washington rendered the judgment of dismissal aforesaid, and the said petitioner alleges, that the time for taking said appeal has now wholly expired and the said petitioner has no other remedy herein.

Ninth - That the said John Leonard is now restrained of his libert by the Sheriff of Whitman County, State of Washington, at Colfax in said Whitman County, and his said imprisonment and restraint is illegal in this; (a) That the said information upon which the said petitioner was tried and convicted does not state facts constituting a crime or an offense against the laws of the State of Washington or of the United States. (b) That the said petitioner is imprisoned and held to answer for a capital and infamous crime, without having been first indicted or presented by a grand Jury as provided by Art. 5 of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States.
(c) That the said petitioner John Leonard is deprived of his liberty and is about to be deprived of his life without hue process of law and in violation of Art. 5 of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States, and in violation of Sec. 3 of Art. 1 of the Constitution of the State of Washington. (d) That the information upon which the said petitioner was trie and convicted, did not inform the said petitioner of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States. (e) That Sec. 21 of Art. 1 of the Constitution of the State of Washington provides, that "Offenses heretofore required to be prosecuted by information or by indictment, as shall be prescribed by law" is contrary to and in violation of Art. 5 and 14 of the Amendments to the C onstitution of the United States, in that the said section does not provide for a preliminary examination of the accused and does not provide that prabable cause shell first be established before the filing of an information against the accused, and in that it deprives the accused of the right of a preliminary examination and of having probable cause of guilt first established before the filing of an information. (f) That the said petitioner is illegally restrained of his liberty in that, the said Sec. 25 of Art. 1. of the Constitution of the State of Washington and laws of the State of Washington, permitting and allowing persons accused of crime to be prosecuted by information are void and in conflict with Art's 5 and 14 of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States. (g) That the said Superior Court of Whitman County, Washington, who tried the said petitioner and rendered the said judgment and sentence herein, had no jurisdiction to try the said petitioner or render the said judgment and sentence upon the said information. (h) That the said information and all of the proceedings had and taken thereunder and thereon, were and are absolutely void and in violation of Art. of Art. 1 of the Constitution of the State of
Washington and in violation of Art.'s 5-6 and 14 of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States.

(1) That the said petiti oner is not held i custody under and by virtue of any process issu ed on any final judgement of a Court of competent jurisdiction, or for any contempt of any Court, officer or body having the authority in the premises to commit, or upon a warrant issued, or upon warrant issued from any Superior Court upon any indictment, or upon any valid or legal warrant issued from any Superior Court upon any valid information, but the said petitioner alleges; that the warrant or pretended warrant under which he is imprisoned and detained is ilegal and void in that, the judgment and sentence upon which the said warrant or pretended warrant was issued is void.

WHEREFORE your said petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeus Corpus may be granted to him, directed to the Sheriff of Whitman County, State of Washington, commanding him to the said Sheriff to have and produce the body of the said petitioner before this Honorable Court, at a time and place in said Writ to be specified, to then and there do and recieve what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning the said petitioner, together with the time and cause of the detention of the said petitioner, and that the said Sheriff have then and there the said writ and his return thereto and thatyour said petitioner may be restored to his liberty and discharged from custody. James E. Fenton Del Leary Smith Attorneys for petitioner.

State of Washington County of Spokane. I, James E. Fenton, being duly sworn say, that I am one of the attorney's for the above named petitioner, that I have read the foregoing petition, know the contents thereof and the same is true as I verily believe; that I verify this petition for the reason that the said petitioner is now confined in the County Jail at Colfax in Whitman County, Washinton, and cannot be had to verify the same, and for the addititional reason that all of the material facts alleged in the above petititon are within my personal knowledge. James E. Fenton Subscribed and sworn to before me this ---- day of June, 1897.
N O T A R Y P U B L I C. For Washington, residing at Spokane, Wash
